title.narrative: Multinational - Programme de renforcement des capacités statistiques, Phase V (PRCS-5)
Multinational - Statistical Capacity Building Program, Phase V (SCB-5)

description.narrative: La cinquième phase du programme de renforcement des capacités statistiques (PRCS-5) a été conçu en raison de la détérioration des Instituts nationaux de la statistique (INS), et en particulier ceux des états en transition depuis le début de la COVID-19. En effet, la pandémie a non seulement perturbé les opérations sur le terrain pour la collecte des données dans le cadre des recensements et des enquêtes de routine prévus antérieurement et qui ont dû être reportés, mais elle a aussi réduit les budgets alloués, car de maigres ressources financières ont été réaffectées pour sauver des vies, protéger les moyens de subsistance et relancer les économies. Le PRCS vise à construire un système statistique africain efficace qui génère des informations statistiques fiables, harmonisées et opportunes couvrant les dimensions du développement politique, économique, social, environnemental, climatique et culturel pour soutenir le programme d'intégration africaine. Ce cinquième PRCS s'appuie sur de nombreuses années d'expérience pratique accumulée et une valeur ajoutée supplémentaire au système statistique africain. Il comprend cinq principales composantes, à savoir : (1) l’amélioration de la disponibilité et la qualité des statistiques économiques, y compris la mesure de l’impact de la Covid-19 ; (2) l’amélioration de la qualité et de la disponibilité des statistiques sociales et établissement de rapports sur la COVID-19 ; (3) la Collecte, gestion et diffusion des données ; (4) la planification stratégique, le développement de systèmes, la coordination et formation ainsi que (5) la gestion de projet.

Les bénéficiaires directs du projet sont les Systèmes statistiques nationaux (SSN) de toute l'Afrique, toutes les Communautés économiques régionales (CER), les Organisations sous-régionales (OSR), les Centres de formation statistique (CFS) et AFRISTAT. Parmi les autres bénéficiaires figurent les partenaires de développement dans les PMR et au niveau régional, y compris la Banque. Les autres bénéficiaires indirects sont tous les peuples d'Afrique, qui bénéficieront d'une capacité statistique améliorée et de statistiques fiables et actualisées.
L’objectif du programme est le renforcement des capacités statistiques dans les 37 PMR à faible revenu et du FAD, ainsi que dans tous les CER, CFS et AFRISTAT.

The direct beneficiaries from the project are the National Statistical Systems (NSSs) across Africa, all the Regional Economic Communities (RECs), the Sub-regional Organizations (SROs), Statistical Training Centers (STCs) and AFRISTAT. Among other beneficiaries are development partners across RMCs and regional levels, including the Bank. Other indirect beneficiaries are all the people of Africa, who will benefit from improved statistical capacity and resultant reliable and timely statistics.

The fifth phase of the Statistical Capacity Building Program (SCB-5) was designed in response to the deterioration of the National Statistical Institutes (NSOs), particularly those in the transitional states since the onset of COVID-19. The pandemic has not only disrupted field operations for data collection in previously planned surveys and censuses that have had to be postponed, but it has also reduced allocated budgets as scarce financial resources were shifted to saving lives, protecting livelihoods and reviving economies. The SCB aims to build an efficient African statistical system that generates reliable, harmonized and timely statistical information covering political, economic, social, environmental, climate and cultural development dimensions to support the African integration agenda. The fifth SCB is anchored on many years of accumulated practical experience and incremental value addition to the African Statistical System. It comprises five main components namely: (1) improving the availability and quality of economic statistics, including the measurement of the COVID-19 impact; (2) improving the quality and availability of Social Statistics and reporting on COVID-19; (3) Data Collection, Management and Dissemination; (4) Strategic Planning, Systems Development, Coordination and Training as well as (5) Project Management.
The purpose of the program is Statistical Capacity Building across all 37 Low-Income and ADF RMCs plus all RECs, STCs and AFRISTAT.

title.narrative: Number of Data Validation and Editing Workshops

Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) having evaluated their National Strategies for the Development of Statistics (NSDS) to improve the implementation and evaluation of Strategy for the Harmonization of Statistics in Africa (SHaSA)

Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) with National Strategy for the Development of Statistics (NSDS)/revised aligned with Strategy for the Harmonization of Statistics in Africa (SHaSA) 2
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) trained on the use of the Big Data for official statistics through the Innovation Lab
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) with an Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) data page updated
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) with deep-dive case studies conducted on their data collection, management and dissemination process

Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) with the National Strategy for the Development of Statistics (NSDS) aligned to relevant Regional Strategy for the Development of Statistics (RSDS)
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) undertaking field and desk work in business registers
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) with national accounts aligned with System of National Accounts (SNA) 2008
Number of single Africa Information Highway (AIH) data portal visitors on average per year

Number of Regional Economic Communities (RECs) having developed/revised their Regional Strategy for the Development of Statistics (RSDS) aligned with Strategy for the Harmonization of Statistics in Africa (SHaSA) 2
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) to have organized a Climate Change Survey Framework
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) supported in the use of cost-effective methods in agricultural statistics
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) to have a report on the pandemic’s impacts
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) with the latest minimum set of agricultural core data
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) undertaking field and desk work in infrastructure statistics
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) with Harmonized Consumer Price Index (HCPI) having updated price reference period
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) to have adopted and implemented the Framework for the Development of Environmental Statistics (FDES)
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) with Purchasing Power Parity (PPP) and derived statistics
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) trained in the use of Statistical Data and Metadata eXchange (SDMX)
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) implementing a National Summary Data Page within their AIH portal
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) trained on Harmonized Consumer Price Index (HCPI) principles and practices
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) undertaking data collection for 2021 International Comparison Program (ICP)
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) with latest PPPs, real expenditures, price level indices
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) with rebased Gross Domestic Products (GDPs) in compliance with System of National Accounts (SNA) 2008 requirements
Number of Regional Member Countries (RMCs) undertaking field and desk work in debt statistics
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) able to report sufficiently disaggregated Tier 1 and 2 Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) indicators
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) with comprehensive sets of quality and disaggregated data by gender
Number of all ADF-Eligible Regional Member Countries (RMCs) with Sectoral Strategy for Development of Statistics (SSDS)
